Package de.hu.gralog.structure

This package together with it's subpackages defines all classes needed to define and use structures in GrALoG.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
GraphFactory<G extends ListenableGraph> This interface defines a Factory for JGraphT-Graphs that can be associated to GrALoG-Structures via StructureTypeInfo.getGraphFactory() in order to store the mathematical graph-structure underlying your GrALoG-Structure.
StructureBeanFactory<GB> This interface defines a Structure-Bean-Factory for GrALoG.
StructureTypeInfoFilter This interface allows to filter StructureTypeInfos
 

Class Summary
Structure<V,E,GB,G extends ListenableGraph<V,E>> This class represents a GrALoG-Structure.
StructureFactory This class acts as a factory to construct GrALoG-Structures (Structure).
StructureTypeInfo<V,E,GB,G extends ListenableGraph<V,E>> Each subclass of this class defines a GrALoG-Structure-Type.
 

Package de.hu.gralog.structure Description

This package together with it's subpackages defines all classes needed to define and use structures in GrALoG.

A GrALoG-Structure is basically a mathematical graph that allows to specify arbitrary properties for it's vertices, edges and the structure itself. In GrALoG this is accomplished by using the JavaBeans-Framework to define vertices, edges and a so called Structure-Bean object. It follows that vertices, edges and the Structure-Bean are seen by GrALoG as JavaBeans which allows them to be hugely customized, i.e. having arbitrary properties and providing GUI-Components that are used by the GrALoG-User to customize these properties.

In GrALoG a structure is represented by the class Structure.

Plugin-Develepers

Please refer to StructureTypeInfo if you want to implement your own type of GrALoG-Structure.
